title: Research Projects
text:
Research Projects



Course Projects
Statistics M254 | Spring 2024

Cell Type Annotation in Single-Cell DNA-seq Data

In this project, I analyze two datasets: BoneMarrow and Pancreas and apply the Seurat package to identify cell types in single-cell DNA-seq data. I tune the parameters to optimize the clustering results and visualize the cell types using umap plots.


Biostatistics 200C [course link] | Spring 2024

Statistical Problems in GLM

title: Jiachen Ai | Computational Biology & Human Genetics
text:
Clustering on Mice DNA Methylation Aging Pattern
Graduate Student Researcher | supervised by Dr.¬†Feng Gao

Applied K-means clustering to study methylation profiles across different aging stages in mice (young, midlife, late-life).

Longitudinal Study on Flu Vaccination Impact: DNA Methylation Influence the Regulation of RIG‚ÄêI Signaling Within UGA6 Cohort
Graduate Student Researcher | supervised by Dr.¬†Matteo Pellegrini in his Lab

Multivariate linear regression with LOOCV to establish prediction models for associations between DNA methylation CpG sites and cellular signaling pathway with sero-protection after influenza injection at day0 and day28, with considering epigenetic confounders, including age, gender, BMI, and cell types.

Computational Genomics Summer Institute (CGSI)
Warren Alpert Computational Biology and AI Network Fellow

Collaborated with faculty on epigenetics data analysis using machine learning and attended workshops on biobanks and AI in biomedical research.

title: Jiachen Ai | Computational Biology & Human Genetics
text:
2021 ‚Äì 2023
Statistical Data Analysis for Biology and Biomedicine Research
Undergraduate Research Assistant

By multivariate regression in R and found significant correlation between rice yield and irrigation amount in 5 growing stages.
Via R, performed logistic regression with backward selection and found 3 categorical variables that correlated with semen quality.
Through deduction and proofs with Markov chains, multivariable calculus and matrices, discussed the recurrence and transience of random walks in three dimensions.

title: Jiachen Ai | Computational Biology & Human Genetics
text:
2019 ‚Äì 2020
Lymphocyte Regeneration after Thymocyte Damage in Zebrafish[slides]
Volunteer | supervised by Dr.¬†Li Li

Discovered that the Cxcl12b/Cxcr4b chemokine signaling pathway plays a key role in the repair of zebrafish T-lymphocytes by real-time PCR (RT-qPCR) and then demonstrated the finding using a receptor antagonist, WZ811.
Detected apoptosis and a significant reduction of thymus lymphocytes through whole mount in situ hybridization (WISH) and confocal microscopy, in zebrafish treated with 2 mM Metronidazole for 12 hours in vivo.

title: Jiachen Ai | Computational Biology & Human Genetics
Jiachen Ai | Computational Biology & Human Genetics
text:
About Me
I‚Äôm a graduate student at UCLA, diving into the exciting world of biostatistics, computational biology, and epigenetics, currently pursuing a Master‚Äôs in Biostatistics at the Fielding School of Public Health. My research explores gene expression patterns across epigenomic, transcriptomic, and cytokine levels, using cutting-edge models to uncover biomarkers and build predictive models related to aging, vaccines, and diseases.
I‚Äôm passionate about mastering mathematical and statistical methods for genetic analysis to push the boundaries of epigenetic research and contribute to the future of precision medicine and personalized healthcare!

title: Jiachen Ai | Computational Biology & Human Genetics
text:
Research Interests

Epigenetics: Investigating dynamics of quintessential epigenomic biomarkers during lifespan.
Statistical Genetics: Modeling gene expression patterns across epigenomic, transcriptomic, and cytokine levels using linear, nonlinear, or statistical learning models to identify biomarkers and build predictive models related to age, vaccines, and chronic diseases.
Bioinformatics: Developing computational tools to map CpG sites to methylation patterns and optimizing algorithms for analyzing high-throughput sequencing data.


Featured Projects

Clustering on Mice DNA Methylation Aging Pattern: Applied K-means clustering to study methylation profiles across different aging stages in mice (young, midlife, late-life).
Longitudinal Study on Flu Vaccination Impact: Established prediction models for associations between DNA methylation CpG sites and cellular signaling pathways with sero-protection after influenza injection at day0 and day28, considering epigenetic confounders
Computational Genomics Summer Institute (CGSI): Collaborated with faculty on epigenetics data analysis using machine learning and attended workshops on biobanks and AI in biomedical research.
